question: Recovery of outlay on water-courses where such recoveries have to be set off against the outlay may at the discretion of Government be taken in reduction of expenditure under the sub-head
Pick the correct one
option_a: Works outlay on water-courses, which may be incurred by Public Works Officers and recoverable by a general levy, whether for a specified or indefinite period when the actual recoveries are required to be set off against the outlay, the Accounts Officer should maintain a suitable proforma account
